A Vernier caliper is an instrument used to measure both the outer and inner diameters of a tube.

text: The inner diameter of a test tube can be measured accurately using a?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Let the forces be F1, and F2.
F1 = m1 a1 = 3 x 2 = 6N

F2 = m2 a2 = 1 x 9 = 9N

F1 : F2 = 6:9 = 2:3

Thus ratio of forces is 2: 3

text: Two bodies have masses in the ratio 3:1. They experience forces which impart to them acceleration in the ratio 2:9 respectively. Find the ratio of forces the masses experienced.

explanation.text:
Explanation
Centripetal Force (F\(_c\)) = \(\frac{mv ^2}{r}\)
= \(mω^2r\)
(Since V = ωr)
F = 100 x 0.2

F =20 N

text: Particles of mass 10\(^{-2}\)kg is fixed to the tip of a fan blade which rotates with angular velocity of 100rad-1. If the radius of the blade is 0.2m, the centripetal force is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
From principle of conservation of linear momentum,
(0.05 x 200) + (0.95 x 0) = (0.05 + 0.95) x V (since collision is inelastic).
10 + 0 = V
Thus V = 10m/s.
Recall Kinetic Energy = \(\frac{1}{2} mv^2\)
\(\therefore\) K.E = 1/2 (0.05 + 0.95) x 10\(^2\)
K.E = 1/2 (1 x 100) = 50 J.

text: A lead bullet of mass 0.05kg is fired with a velocity of 200ms\(^{-1}\) into a lead block of mass 0.95kg. Given that the lead block can move freely, the final kinetic energy after impact is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Height h = 1/2 (U\(^2\)/g) = 10\(^2\)/20 = 5m

Energy before hitting ground is = P.E at the height of 5m.

P.E = mgh = 0.1 x 10 x 10= 10 J
 K.E = 1/2 MV\(^2\) = 5J
T.E = K.E + P.E = 5 + 10 = 15J

(take g = 10ms-2)
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Power = Force x \(\frac{distance}{time}\) = \(\frac{m(v - u)}{t} \times v\)

\(\frac{800(25 - 0)}{20} \times 25\)
= 2.5 x 10\(^{4}\) watts

text: When temperature of a liquid increases, its surface tension
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
At constant T, P1 V1 = P2 V2.

Let P1 = P0 and V1 = V0, then solve accordingly.
As pressure is varies inversely as volume according to:

Boyle's law, also referred to as the Boyle–Mariotte law, or Mariotte's law, is an experimental gas law that describes how the pressure of a gas tends to decrease as the volume of the container increases.

As volume is reduced by one-fifth; pressure will increase by five times.

text: A gas at a volume of V0 in a container at pressure P0 is compressed to one-fifth of its volume. What will be its pressure if the magnitude of its original temperature T is constant?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Energy at the height = mgh
This energy is converted to heat energy - mcΔt
∴ From the principle of energy conversion,
mcΔt = mgh
m x 450 x Δt = m x 10 x 20
∴ Δt = m x 10 x 20/(m x 450)
= 200/450
= 4/9°C

explanation.text:
Explanation
Temperature Gradient = \(\frac{\Delta {\text{temp.}}}{\text{thickness}}\)

= \(\frac{80 - 20}{0.02}\)

= \(\frac{60}{0.02}\)

= 3000Km-1

= 3.0 x 103Km-1

text: The temperature gradient across a copper rod of thickness 0.02m, maintained at two temperature junctions of 20°C and 80°C respectively is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Heat given off by the copper = MCt
= 2 x 400 x (100 - 0)
Heat absorbed by the ice = ML
= M x 3.3 x 105
Heat lost = Heat gained
∴ M x 3.3 x 105 = 2 x 400 x 100
∴ M = (2 x 400 x 100)/3.3 x 105 
= 8/33Kg

subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
The general wave equation is given by;
y = A Sin(wt - 2πx/Wavelength)
where w = angular velocity
Thus comparing this equation with the equation
y = 0.25 x 10-3 Sin (500t - 0.025x)
That Amplitude = 0.25 x 10-3m
the angular velocity(w) = 500 (the coefficient of t in both equations)
∴ w = 500 rad s-1
= 5.00 x 102rad s-1

text: If a sound wave goes from a cold air region to a hot air region, its wavelength will
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
The lowest note (fundamental note) emitted by any stretched string has a fundamental frequecy fo = V/2l = 40Hz
The 1st overtone = 2fo = 2 x 40 = 80Hz
2nd overtone = 3fo = 3 x 40 = 120Hz
3rd overtone = 4fo = 4 x 40 = 160Hz
4th overtone = 5fo = 5 x 40 = 200Hz

Overtones between 40Hz and 180Hz are 80Hz, 120Hz, 160Hz = 3 Overtones

text: The lowest note emitted by a stretched string has a frequency of 40Hz. How many overtones are there between 40hz and 180Hz?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
The image of an object placed in front of a plane mirror is always as far behind the mirror as the object is in front of the mirror. Thus when the object is 4m in front of the mirror, the image will be 4m behind the mirror. But when the mirror is moved in towards the man, (that is the man is now 3m from the mirror), the image distance will again decrease by 1m from behind the mirror. Thus the new image position is 3m behind the mirror. Therefore, the distance between the man and his new image is 6m.

text: A man stands 4m in front of a plane mirror. If the mirror is moved 1m towards the man, the distance between him and his new image is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Refractive index
= \(\frac{Sin i}{Sin r}\) = \(\frac{\text{Vel. of light in air}}{\text{vel. of light in glass}}\)

= \(\frac{Sin i}{Sin 30^o}\)= \(\frac{3.0 \times 10^8}{2.0 \times 10^8}\)

= Sin i = \(\frac{(3.0 \times 10^8 \times Sin 30^o)}{2.0 \times 10^8}\)

= Sin i = \(\frac{(3.0 \times 10^8 \times 0.5)}{2.0 \times 10^8}\)

= \(\frac{1.5}{2}\)

= 0.75

explanation.text:
Explanation
Since all the cells are connected in parallel, the effective e.m.f. is just that of one single cell. Which means e.m.f. = 1.5V

However, the effective internal resistance adds as parallel arrangement given as
1/r = 1/r1 + 1/r2 + 1/r3 + 1/r4
= 1/4 + 1/4 + 1/4 + 1/4
= 1Ω
∴ r = 1Ω

Answer = 1.5V, 1Ω

text: Four cells each of e.m.f 1.5V and internal resistance of 4Ω are connected in parallel. What is the effective e.m.f. and internal resistance of the combination?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
The maximum current drawn by the cooker is given by;
I = \(\frac{P}{V}\)
∴ I = \(\frac{\text{3000}}{200}\)
I = 15A
The fuse rating = I \(\times\) 125% (the fuse is rated at 125% of the normal operating current)
Hence, the fuse rating = 15A \(\times\) (\(\frac{125}{100}\)) = 18.75amps
Therefore, the best fuse is 20A.

text: A 3000W electric cooker is to be used on a 200V mains circuit. Which of the fuses below can be used safely with the cooker?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Shunt resistance is usually given as
R = igrg/(I - ig)
Where R = 0.05Ω
rg = 5Ω
I = 2M
∴ ig = IR/(rg + R)
= (2 x 0.05)/(5 + 0.05)
= 0.10/5.05
= 0.0198A
= 19.8mA
= 20mA

explanation.text:
Explanation
Energy of a particle is given by
E = hf = hV/λ (since V = fxλ)
But in terms of mass M, E = ∆MV2
∴ ∆MV2 = hV/λ
∆MV = h/λ
∴ V = h/λ∆M
V = 6.63 x 10-34/(10-27 x 10-8)
V = 6.63 x 10-34/10-35
V = 6.63 x 10-34+35
V = 6.63 x 10
V = 66.3ms-1

explanation.text:
Explanation
At resonance, inductive reactant XL is equal to the capacitive reactance XC
i.e. XL = XC
and XL = VL/IL
and XC = VC/IC

Again since the components are in series, the same current flows in the series arrangment
i.e. IL = IC
at resonance, VL/IL = VC/IC
∴ VL = VC
= 40V

explanation.text:
Explanation



From Ohms Law, E = I(R +X)
=> E = I1(R1 + X)
again, E = I2(R2 + X)
=> I1(R1 + X) = I2(R2 + X)
∴ 5(8 + X) = 7(5 + X)
40 + 5X = 35 + 7X
7X - 5X = 40 - 35
2X = 5
X = 5/2
= 2.5Ω

= 5μF = 5 x 10-6 x (100)2
∴E = 1/2CV2
= 1/2 x 5 x 10-6 x 104

= E2/R1 x R2/E2 = R2/R1
∴P1/P2 = R2/R1
